(ultimately owned by [[Comcast]]) |divisions = |subsid = |caption = |homepage = }} '''Gramercy Pictures''' is an American [[Production company|film production]] label of [[Universal Studios]]' [[Focus Features]] division, both of which are owned by [[NBCUniversal]] which is ultimately owned by [[Comcast]]. It was founded in May 1992 as a [[joint venture]] between [[PolyGram Filmed Entertainment]] and [[Universal Pictures]]. Gramercy was the distributor of PolyGram films in the United States and Canada and also served as Universal's art-house division. After Seagram's buyout of PolyGram, Gramercy along with [[October Films]] were merged by [[Barry Diller]] to form [[USA Films]] in 1999. In 2015, Focus Features (the current art-house division for Universal) revived the name as a label for action, horror and sci-fi genre films. ==History== Gramercy Pictures was formed in 1992 as a joint venture between PolyGram Filmed Entertainment and Universal Pictures.{{cite news|last1=Petski|first1=Denise|title=Focus Features Revives Gramercy Pictures Label For Genre Films|url=http://deadline.com/2015/05/focus-features-revives-gramercy-pictures-label-genre-films-1201430500/|accessdate=May 20, 2015|publisher=deadline.com|date=May 20, 2015}} Gramercy Pictures released its first film, the [[Mario Van Peebles]] western [[Posse (1993 film)|''Posse'']], in May 1993.{{cite journal|author=Staff|title=In Winner's Circle; Miramax's 'Crying Game' paces indies; New Line still running strong|date=August 17, 1993|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|publisher=Reed Business Information|quote=Off to an auspicious start is Gramercy Pictures, with its first release, 'Posse,' immediately making the chart [of largest rentals from independent distributors]}}{{cite web |title=Box office information for ''Posse'' (1993) |last= |first= |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=posse.htm |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=November 5, 2010}} In January 1996, PolyGram brought the 50% stake owned by Universal thus assuming full control of Gramercy.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/01/11/business/gramercy-sold-to-polygram.html|title=Gramercy Sold To Polygram|date=11 January 1996|work=Reuters|via=The New York Times}} The distributor also had box office hits in 1994's ''[[Four Weddings and a Funeral]]'', 1996's ''[[Fargo (film)|Fargo]]'' and 1997's ''[[Bean (film)|Bean]]''. Several Gramercy releases of the 1990s have grown in stature to become [[cult classics]] in the present day: ''[[The Big Lebowski]]'', ''[[Dazed and Confused (film)|Dazed and Confused]]'', ''[[Clay Pigeons]]'' and ''[[Mallrats]]''. In addition, 1995's ''[[The Usual Suspects]]'' won two Oscars, for [[Best Original Screenplay]] ([[Christopher McQuarrie]]) and [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor|Best Supporting Actor]] ([[Kevin Spacey]]).{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} When [[Seagram]] acquired [[PolyGram]] in 1998, the latter was merged and folded into Universal; as a result, it reacquired Gramercy as it controlled Universal. In turn, Seagram sold the bulk of the PolyGram film library titles released up until March 31, 1996 to [[Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer]] in 1999, and later on, it sold Gramercy and another specialty division, [[October Films]], to [[Barry Diller]]'s [[USA Network]]s, which merged both companies into [[USA Films]].{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=aEJFAAAAIBAJ&sjid=wLsMAAAAIBAJ&pg=6746,3385144&dq=gramercy%20pictures%20barry%20diller&hl=en|title=The Telegraph-Herald - Google News Archive Search|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1999/sep/28/business/fi-14956|title=Universal Adds Division for Specialty Films|first=JAMES|last=BATES|date=28 September 1999|publisher=|via=LA Times}} USA Films was then merged with Universal's own art-house division, Universal Focus, and transformed into [[Focus Features]] in 2002 after [[Vivendi|Vivendi Universal]] acquired USA Networks from Diller.{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} ===Revival=== In May 2015, [[Focus Features]] announced that the Gramercy label has been revived to release action, horror and sci-fi genre films. {{Multiple issues| {{more footnotes|date=November 2017}} {{advert|date=November 2017}} {{more citations needed|date=November 2017}} }} '''Health marketing''' is a new, customer-centered, approach to [[public health]] promotion that applies traditional marketing principles and theories alongside science-based strategies to protect and promote the health of diverse populations.It involves creating, communicating, and delivering messages for the public on [[Preventive medicine|prevention]], [[health promotion]] and health protection.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdc.gov/healthcommunication/toolstemplates/whatishm.html|title=What is Health Marketing? {{!}} Gateway to Health Communication {{!}} CDC|date=2017-02-23|website=www.cdc.gov|language=en-us|access-date=2017-11-20}} Health marketing is one of the ways advancements in medicine and in health-protecting services, such as insurance, are made widely known. A good example is the current drive in [[Kenya]] to promote circumcision among communities that do not customarily circumcise. [[Medical research]]ers have recently documented that circumcision is 65% effective in preventing [[HIV]] infection among men. The marketing strategy would follow the traditional 4 "P's" of marketing namely: *The "product" in question in this case the surgical procedure. *The "place" which refers to the access to this procedure. *"Promotion" refers to creating awareness and hence demand. *"Price" refers to the cost of the procedure e.g. money, time, reputation etc. "Health marketing" is a term rarely used in public health and related disciplines. "Social marketing" or "integrated marketing communication" are more commonly used in public health and other disciplines to refer to marketing-based planning frameworks for public health communication.
== Medical marketing in the private sector == '''Health marketing''' or '''Medical Marketing''' is a specialized branch of [[marketing]]. Medical marketing was born from the necessity for private health professionals to attract new patients, the characteristics of the health market makes it a unique kind of marketing. Medical marketing is usually a [[business to consumer]] (B2C) service. Doctors using this type of marketing usually offer beauty related services, such as [[aesthetic medicine]], [[plastic surgery]], [[dental surgery]] or [[dermatology]]. === Regulations. === In many countries it is forbidden to pay for advertising of medical procedures, specially in aesthetics and [[plastic surgery]]. Showing “before and after” pictures or making references to someone’s body type can be seen as harmful for society. The solution for a health care professional or a [https://www.medicalmarketingagency.net medical marketing agency] is [[Instagram marketing]] since nowadays it remains unregulated, being the fastest growing social media in the planet gives doctors an opportunity to acquire new patients through Instagram Marketing.
== See also == * [[Marketing mix]] * [[Services marketing]] == References == {{reflist}} * [https://www.cdc.gov/healthcommunication/ CDC - Gateway to Health Communication & Social Marketing Practice] * [http://healthcaremarketing.ning.com/profiles/blogs/internet-marketing-for-doctors Internet Marketing for Doctors - The Healthcare Marketing Community and Blog] *[https://www.medicalmarketingagency.net/ Medical Marketing on Social Media] * [https://www.healthcare-marketing.net/ Healthcare Marketing Company] [[Category:Marketing by industry]] [[Category:Health promotion]] [[Category:Healthcare industry]]

{{Infobox officeholder | name = Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais | office = | order = | image = Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais.jpg | imagesize = | caption = | birth_date = October 28, 1967 | birth_place = [[Fribourg]], Switzerland | nationality = [[Switzerland|Swiss]] & [[Angola]]n | occupation = {{plain list| *Entrepreneur *Chief Executive Officer }} | website = {{url|www.jeanclaudebastosdemorais.com}} }} '''Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais''' (born October 28, 1967 in [[Fribourg]])<ref name="A">{{cite web |url=https://www.srf.ch/sendungen/reporter/jean-claude-bastos-und-das-wunder-von-angola |title=Jean-Claude Bastos und das Wunder von Angola |author=Simon Christen |date=17 December 2017 |publisher=SRF |access-date=30 December 2017}}</ref> is a [[Switzerland|Swiss]]-[[Angola]]n entrepreneur<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2017/11/03/how-swiss-angolan-investor-jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-plans-to-deliver-better-healthcare-in-africa/#27ea00fa28cf|title=How Swiss-Angolan Investor Jean Claude Bastos De Morais Plans To Deliver Better Healthcare In Africa|last=Nsehe|first=Mfonobong|work=Forbes|access-date=2017-11-03|language=en}}</ref> who has founded and led several businesses over the course of his career. Among these are Quantum Global Group, an international investment group with a particular focus on Africa<ref name=":0" /> and Banco Kwanza Invest, Angola’s first [[investment banking|investment bank]].
== Family == Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais was born on October 28, 1967 in Fribourg, Switzerland.<ref name="A" /> He is of bi-national heritage. His father is from Angola<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2014/10/01/meet-the-swiss-tycoon-who-is-funding-african-innovation/#2d59e4006189 |title=Meet The Swiss Entrepreneur Who Is Funding African Innovation |author=Mfonobong Nsehe |date=1 October 2014 |publisher=Forbes |access-date=31 December 2017}}</ref> and his mother is Swiss, coming from an entrepreneurial family.<ref name="Niyi Aderibigbe">{{cite web |url=http://thenerveafrica.com/6211/jean-claude-de-morais-innovation-entrepreneurship-and-growth/ |title=GrowthCore with Jean-Claude de Morais: Innovation can speed up economic diversification and job creation in Africa |author=Niyi Aderibigbe |date=3 June 2016 |publisher=The Nerve Africa |access-date=31 December 2017}}</ref> His maternal grandfather was an industrialist in the watch industry<ref>{{cite web |url=https://trueafrica.co/article/jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-the-man-supporting-innovation-in-slums-with-money-and-expertise/ |title=Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais: the publicity-shy entrepreneur unleashing innovation in Angolan slums |author=Claude Grunitzky |date=6 December 2016 |publisher=True Africa |access-date=31 December 2017}}</ref> and invented the light inside the watch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://newafricanmagazine.com/jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-africas-innovation-guru/ |title=Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais: Africa’s innovation guru |author=Regina Jane Jere |date=27 June 2017 |publisher=NewAfrican |access-date=31 December 2017}}</ref> According to Bastos, his late Angolan grandmother inspired him to establish the African Innovation Foundation in 2009.<ref name="Niyi Aderibigbe"/>
== Education and career == Bastos studied [[economics]] at the [[University of Fribourg]] and received a Master of Arts in Management.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.jeanclaudebastosdemorais.com|title=Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais|website=Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais|language=en|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> He financed his studies by starting a regional [[mergers and acquisitions]] business that sold small companies.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://thenerveafrica.com/6211/jean-claude-de-morais-innovation-entrepreneurship-and-growth/ |title=GrowthCore with Jean-Claude de Morais: Innovation can speed up economic diversification and job creation in Africa |author=Niyi Aderibigbe |date=3 June 2016 |publisher=The Nerve Africa |access-date=15 January 2018}}</ref> In 1989, Bastos joined [[Deloitte]] as a consultant and later Abegglen Management Partners. In 1995, he founded a venture capital company focused on Swiss [[Small and medium-sized enterprises|SMEs]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2014/10/01/meet-the-swiss-tycoon-who-is-funding-african-innovation/#2d59e4006189 |title=Meet The Swiss Entrepreneur Who Is Funding African Innovation |author=Mfonobong Nsehe |date=1 October 2014 |publisher=Forbes |access-date=15 January 2018}}</ref>
In 2007, Bastos de Morais founded Quantum Global Group.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.africaninnovation.org/jc.bastos.html|title=Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais {{!}} African Innovation Foundation|last=|website=www.africaninnovation.org|access-date=2017-11-03}}</ref> He is Quantum's current [[Chief executive officer|Chief Executive Officer]].<ref name=":0" /> In 2008, Bastos de Morais founded Banco Kwanza Invest,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2014/10/01/meet-the-swiss-tycoon-who-is-funding-african-innovation/ |title=Meet The Swiss Entrepreneur Who Is Funding African Innovation |author=Mfonobong Nsehe |date=1 October 2014 |publisher=Forbes |access-date=21 November 2017}}</ref> Angola's first investment bank.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/chriswright/2014/09/05/inside-angolas-sovereign-wealth-fund/ |title=Inside Angola's Sovereign Wealth Fund |author=Chris Wright |date=5 September 2014 |publisher=Forbes |access-date=21 November 2017}}</ref>
In 2015 he launched the hybrid innovation hub, Fábrica de Sabão<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.fabricadesabao.co.ao/en/|title=Home - Fábrica de Sabão|website=Fábrica de Sabão|language=en-US|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> (The Soap Factory) to support innovation projects in Angola. The hub is a collaboration with the government, which leases it its premises. Fábrica de Sabão was built as an inclusive model to enable marginalized communities to participate in sustainable enterprise such as urban manufacturing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://thenerveafrica.com/6211/jean-claude-de-morais-innovation-entrepreneurship-and-growth/|title=GrowthCore with Jean-Claude de Morais: Innovation can speed up economic diversification and job creation in Africa|date=3 June 2016|work=The Nerve Africa|access-date=2017-07-11|language=en-US}}</ref>
==NGOs== In 2017, Bastos de Morais was elected an international council member, [[Belfer Center for Science and International Affairs]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.belfercenter.org/person/jean-claude-bastos-de-morais|title=International Council: Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais|publisher=Harvard Kennedy School|accessdate=5 March 2017}}</ref>
== African Innovation Foundation == In 2009, he founded the African Innovation Foundation (AIF)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.africaninnovation.org|title=Home - African Innovation Foundation|website=www.africaninnovation.org|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> which aims to support sustainable projects in Africa. The Foundation's Innovation Prize for Africa (IPA) was launched in 2011 in cooperation with the [[United Nations Economic Commission for Africa]] (UNECA).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.innovationprizeforafrica.org|title=Innovation Prize for Africa|website=www.innovationprizeforafrica.org|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> In 2016 the Innovation Prize for Africa celebrated its 5th anniversary,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/06/16/africa/aif-prize-inventions-2016/index.html|title=The 10 best inventions from Africa|last=CNN|first=Katie Pisa and Sophie Morlin-Yron, for|work=CNN|access-date=2018-02-20}}</ref> and the AIF signed a [[Memorandum of understanding|Memorandum of Understanding]] (MoU) with the [[World Intellectual Property Organization]] (WIPO) for cooperation to support African innovators.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/wipo/26677844740|title=WIPO and African Innovation Foundation Sign Collaboration Agreement|work=Flickr|access-date=2018-02-20|language=en-us}}</ref> In February 2017 the AIF signed a MoU with the Botswana Innovation Hub to support innovations in [[Botswana]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://innovationprizeforafrica.org/news13-02-17.html|title=News 13-02-2017 - Innovation Prize for Africa|website=innovationprizeforafrica.org|access-date=2018-02-20}}</ref> In addition to the IPA, the AIF founded the ZuaHub, a platform that connects innovators with resources.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnbcafrica.com/apo/2017/10/10/african-innovation-foundation-call-for-applications-innovation-prize-for-africa-2018-awards-investing-in-inclusive-innovation-ecosystems/|title=African Innovation Foundation - Call for Applications: Innovation Prize for Africa 2018 Awards “Investing In Inclusive Innovation Ecosystems” - CNBC Africa|date=2017-10-10|work=CNBC Africa|access-date=2018-02-20|language=en-US}}</ref> By 2017 the IPA had a database of over 6000 innovators from 51 African countries.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://riseafricarise.com/innovation-prize-for-africa-2017-pauline-mujawamariya-koelbl/|title=Innovation Prize for Africa 2017: An interview with Pauline Mujawamariya Koelbl|date=2016-12-18|work=Rise Africa Rise|access-date=2018-02-20|language=en-GB}}</ref>
=== African Law Library === The AIF also initiated the ''African Law Library'' (ALL). The project was launched on 28 November 2013 at the [[African Union]]'s headquarters in [[Addis Ababa]], [[Ethiopia]]. With ALL Bastos implemented his idea of an online portal offering access to a wide range of legal documents as well as law and governance texts from African countries.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.globethics.net/news/all-news/-/asset_publisher/uK4o/content/african-law-library-launches|title=African Law Library launches - Ethics News - Globethics.net|website=www.globethics.net|language=en-US|access-date=2018-02-20}}</ref> The [[HuffPost|Huffington Post]] reported that 'in June 2014 alone, more than 10,000 research sessions were initiated on the African Law Library platform'. In March 2015 over 4500 regional and national court cases, 3600 legislative acts and 8000 secondary sources from eight African countries were published online.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/amolo-ngweno/democratizing-access-to-l_b_6580880.html|title=Democratizing Access to Legal Information -- For Every African|last=Ng'weno|first=Amolo|date=2015-02-03|website=Huffington Post|language=en-US|access-date=2018-02-20}}</ref>
== Philanthropic activities == In October 2011 Bastos founded the Kitangana Tennis Project for orphans in Angola.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gsb.uct.ac.za/jean-claude-bastos-de-morais|title=Mr Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais|website=www.gsb.uct.ac.za|language=en|access-date=2018-05-28}}</ref> In 2017, his Quantum Global Group sponsored the Muhr Awards for Arab films at the [[Dubai International Film Festival]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thriveglobal.com/stories/20791-diff-2017-features-emirati-cinema-jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-cate-blanchett-and-patrick-stewart-grace-the-event|title=DIFF 2017 features Emirati cinema, Jean Claude Bastos de Morais, Cate Blanchett, and Patrick Stewart grace the event|website=www.thriveglobal.com|language=en|access-date=2018-05-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dubaifilmfest.com/en/news/25/151442/diff_welcomes_quantum_global_to_sponsor_the_prestigious_muhr_awards.html|title=Dubai International Film Festival {{!}} NEWS 2018|website=Dubai International Film Festival|access-date=2018-05-28}}</ref> In addition, Bastos supports several Universities. He sponsors a research project at the Center of Neuroscience ZNZ, a collaboration between the [[University of Zurich]] and the [[ETH Zurich|Swiss Federal Institute of Technology ETH]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.globethics.net/-/meet-our-authors-jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-switzerland-and-angola|title=Meet our authors - Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais, Switzerland and Angola - Ethics News - Globethics.net|website=www.globethics.net|language=en-US|access-date=2018-05-28}}</ref> He also serves on the advisory board of the Event Letterari Monte Verita Festival, the Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum (OMFIF) and the [[University of Cape Town Graduate School of Business]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gsb.uct.ac.za/jean-claude-bastos-de-morais|title=Mr Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais|website=www.gsb.uct.ac.za|language=en|access-date=2018-05-28}}</ref>
==Corruption allegations== In 2011 he was convicted together with his partner{{who|date=November 2017}} by a criminal court in Switzerland for "repeated qualified criminal mismanagement". Both have illegally paid out money in an investment company under their control, which partly lined their own pockets.<ref>Christian Brönnimann: [https://interaktiv.tagesanzeiger.ch/2017/paradise-papers/angola-bastos/?openincontroller ''Wie ein Schweizer von Angolas Milliarden profitiert.''] Tages-Anzeiger, 5. November 2017.</ref> In 2017 the conviction played a major role in public discussions of his business activities which were uncovered by journalists in the [[Paradise Papers]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-41906123|title=Tycoon made $41m from ‘people’s fund’|last=Meisel|first=Anna|date=2017-11-07|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-05-28|last2=Grossman|first2=David|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.srf.ch/play/tv/rundschau/video/swiss-connection-spiel-mit-angolas-milliarden?id=a4d0c7af-eb28-46f1-8b4c-d5804e3a5dfe&station=69e8ac16-4327-4af4-b873-fd5cd6e895a7|title=Swiss Connection: Spiel mit Angolas Milliarden - TV - Play SRF|website=Play SRF|language=de|access-date=2018-05-28}}</ref><ref>Panama Papers, Leaks reveal extensive siphoning of $5bn Angolan sovereign wealth fund, 2016: {{cite web |url=https://panamapapers.investigativecenters.org/angola/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-05-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160529034238/https://panamapapers.investigativecenters.org/angola/ |archivedate=29 May 2016 |df= }}</ref>
== Angola sovereign wealth fund == In November 2017 the [[BBC News]] reported about him in relation to the [[Paradise Papers]].<ref name="demorais">{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-41906123|title=Paradise Papers: Tycoon made $41m from 'people's fund'|last=|first=|date=|website=BBC News|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-11-07}}</ref> The Paradise Papers reported his use of Angola's [[sovereign wealth fund]] for his own investment projects.<ref name="par">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/nov/07/angola-sovereign-wealth-fund-jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-paradise-papers|title=Angola sovereign wealth fund's manager used its cash for his own projects|author=David Left|date=7 November 2017|work=The Guardian|accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref> After the Paradise Papers were leaked<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/nov/07/angola-sovereign-wealth-fund-jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-paradise-papers|title=Angola sovereign wealth fund's manager used its cash for his own projects|last=Pegg|first=David|date=2017-11-07|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-10-17}}</ref> licenses of seven funds of Bastos' Quantum Global were suspended on Mauritius after a visit of Angolan officials.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-04-09/suspended-mauritian-funds-said-to-be-linked-to-angolan-founder|title=Mauritius Suspends Quantum Funds After Angola Official Visit|last=|first=|date=2018-04-09|website=Bloomberg|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-17}}</ref> The Mauritius Supreme Court froze 519 million USD on 58 bank accounts of Quantum Global in early April 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-04-10/mauritius-is-said-to-freeze-519-million-of-quantum-s-assets|title=Mauritius Freezes $519 Million of Quantum’s Assets|last=|first=|date=2018-04-10|website=Bloomberg|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-17}}</ref> In London a British court froze 3 billion USD on Quantum Global accounts at the end of April 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-24/son-of-ex-angolan-president-seeks-to-overturn-u-k-freeze-order|title=Ex-Angolan Leader’s Son Seeks Overturn of Freeze Order|last=|first=|date=2018-04-28|website=Bloomberg|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-17}}</ref>
At the end of July 2018 the freezing of British bank accounts was lifted by London's [[High Court of Justice|High Court]]. It ruled, that the freezing was based on false information. The court accused the state funds representatives of "breaches of the duty of disclosure" in the fund's application for a freezing and called this breaches "substantial" and "culpable".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-angola-swf-litigation/uk-judge-lifts-asset-freeze-order-against-quantum-global-in-angolan-swf-case-idUKKBN1KL1W9|title=UK judge lifts asset freeze order against Quantum Global in Angolan...|last=Milhench|first=Claire|work=U.K.|access-date=2018-10-17|language=en-GB}}</ref>
In September 2018 Bastos was arrested in Angola.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-45640818|title=Ex-president's son detained over 'fraud'|last=Meisel|first=Anna|date=2018-09-25|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-10-17|language=en-GB}}</ref> Quantum Global accused Angola of coercion and intimidation to forces Bastos to surrender assets.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ft.com/content/d9ce0e80-c5b4-11e8-8167-bea19d5dd52e|title=Angola accused of coercion in holding head of Swiss investment group|last=|first=|date=2018-10-01|website=Financial Times|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-17}}</ref>
==Writing== *He is the co-editor of the book ''Innovation Ethics. African and Global Perspectives'',<ref>http://www.globethics.net/documents/4289936/13403236/GE_Global_7_web.pdf/8d19e8ab-de35-4fd9-ad87-6deac077d3fc</ref> co-published by Globethics.net and the AIF. The book looks at innovation ethics and the “ethical innovator,”<ref>{{Cite book|title=Innovation Ethics|last=Jean-Claude Bastos de Morais|first=Christoph Stückelberger|publisher=Global Ethics.net|year=2014|isbn=978-2-88931-003-6|location=Geneva|pages=70, Innovation Ethics for Value-based Innovation, Christoph Stückelberger}}</ref>{{clarify|date=November 2017}} from multidisciplinary and international perspectives with a focus on Africa. *''The Convergence of Nations: Why Africa’s Time Is Now'', OMFIF Press,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.omfif.org/shop/the-convergence-of-nations-why-africas-time-is-now/|title=The Convergence Of Nations: Why Africa's time is now |publisher=OMFIF Press |year=2015|website=www.omfif.org|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref> in collaboration with a team of 31 authors from 15 nations on how Africa can benefit from changes in the world political and economic environment. *''SEED'' is a collaboration with the African Innovation Foundation (AIF), a Swiss-registered foundation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.globalinnovationexchange.org/organizations/african-innovation-foundation|title=African Innovation Foundation|website=www.globalinnovationexchange.org|language=en|access-date=2017-07-11}} </ref> ''SEED'' was published to reinforce the value and benefit of seeding innovation in all fields of development for a rich and prosperous Africa.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.biztechafrica.com/article/aif-launches-commemorative-book/11481/|title=AIF launches commemorative book|work=BiztechAfrica|access-date=2017-07-11}}</ref>
==Notes== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== *http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jean-claude-bastos-de-morais/ *http://www.itnewsafrica.com/2015/05/what-if-african-nations-operated-as-one-big-innovation-ecosystem/ *http://www.euromoney.com/Article/3112458/Angola-fund-launch-leaves-questions-unanswered.html *http://www.jeanclaudebastosdemorais.com - personal website *http://www.quantumglobalgroup.com — website of Quantum Global Group *http://www.africabusinesscommunities.com/index.php/rss-abc-interviews/201082-jean-claude-bastos-de-morais-quantum-global-group-how-to-do-business-in-africa

KMKI (1998-2015) | owner = [[Salem Media Group]] | licensee = Inspiration Media of Texas, LLC | webcast = [http://65.19.173.132/347848 Listen live] | website = [http://www.620amkexb.com/ 620amkexb.com] | affiliations = [[Associated Press]]
[[Bloomberg Radio]] | sister_stations = [[KLTY-FM|KLTY]], [[KSKY]], [[KTNO]], [[KWRD-FM]], [[K273BJ]] }} '''KEXB''' (620 [[AM broadcasting|AM]]) is a [[News/Talk|Financial News/Talk]] formatted [[Broadcasting|broadcast]] [[radio station]] licensed to [[Plano, Texas]], serving the [[Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex]]. The station is owned by [[Salem Media Group]].[http://radioinsight.com/blog/headlines/93236/salem-acquires-disney-stations-in-boston-dallas/ Salem Acquires Disney Stations in Boston and Dallas] - ''Radio Insight'' Programming is supplied by [[broadcast syndication|syndicated]] radio shows from [[Bloomberg Radio]], [[Ray Lucia]], Self Directed Investor Talk{{cite web|title=Self Directed Investor Talk|url=https://SelfDirected.org/podcasts/investor-talk|website=SelfDirected.org|accessdate=22 March 2017}} and others,{{cite web|title=KEXB Program Guide|url=http://www.620amkexb.com/program-guide-weekdays/|website=620amKEXB.com|accessdate=22 March 2017}} as well as paid broadcasts from financial experts and planners who advertise their services. ==History== ===KWFT in Wichita Falls 1939-1994=== KEXB originally had its start in [[Wichita Falls, Texas]], as '''KWFT'''. KWFT radio existed from 1939 to 1994 on an AM frequency of 620 [[kilohertz]]. It was the first radio station to continuously operate in the city and was a regional channel that could be heard across a large geographical area of [[Texas]] and [[Oklahoma]], as well as some bordering states during the daytime. The station was a [[CBS]] affiliate. On December 19, 1947, the [[Federal Communications Commission]] approved the sale of KWFT from Mr. and Mrs. Joe P. Carrigan, Laura Lou Carrigan and Mrs. Elizabeth Carrigan Simpson to Edward H. Rowley, H.J. Griffith and Kenyon Brown, operating as KWFT, Incorporated.{{cite news|title=KWFT Wichita Falls Sale Gets Approval of FCC|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-BC/BC-1947/1947-12-22-BC.pdf|accessdate=28 October 2014|agency=Broadcasting|date=December 22, 1947}} In 1953, KWFT joined other radio stations in the [[United States]] by plunging into the new medium of [[television]]. '''KWFT-TV''' signed on the air onto channel 6 on March 1 and was the first television station in the city. It was an affiliate of the CBS television network. KWFT later sold the TV station in 1956 at which time channel 6 became '''KSYD-TV''' and later '''[[KAUZ-TV]]''' in 1963, continuing as the CBS affiliate for the Wichita Falls-Lawton market. KWFT Radio continued for many years after the divesture of the TV station as a radio station emphasizing local and national news, weather, farm reports and middle-of-the-road music format. However, the emergence of a preponderance of FM stations in Wichita Falls offering country and rock music formats during the 1970s and 1980s greatly cut into KWFT's audience and advertising dollars, leading to the sale of the station in the mid-1990s to a new owner who signed off KWFT's last broadcast at 11:59 p.m. on December 24, 1994. ===AM 620's move to DFW: KAAM and Radio Disney=== About two years later, the 620 frequency formerly assigned to Wichita Falls returned to the airwaves in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex as '''[[KAAM]]'''. The station was sold to [[The Walt Disney Company|Disney]] for $12 million and switch to the [[Radio Disney]] format in July 1998.{{cite news|last1=Sayewitz|first1=Ronni|title=Radio Disney eyes doubling its stations by '99|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/dallas/stories/1998/08/10/story6.html|accessdate=June 8, 2016|work=Dallas Business Journal|publisher=American City Business Journals|date=August 9, 1998}} Also, KAAM was renamed '''KMKI''' (from Disney Character [[Mickey Mouse|'''M'''ic'''K'''ey Mouse]]). Up until Radio Disney's move from [[Dallas]] to [[Burbank, California]], KMKI was the network's [[flagship station]]. Sometime in May 2014, [[Mediabase]] has moved KMKI, along with other Radio Disney-affiliated stations to the [[Contemporary hit radio|Top 40/CHR]] panel. Although Radio Disney is still considered a Children's station.[http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/128957/mediabase-announces-panel-changes Mediabase Announces Panel Changes] (Published April 22, 2014, Retrieved August 8, 2014) [[File:Radio Disney Dallas.png|200px|thumb|Final Radio Disney logo for KMKI.]] On August 13, 2014, Disney put KMKI and twenty-two other [[Radio Disney]] stations up for sale, in order to focus more on digital distribution of the Radio Disney network. Originally, KMKI's affiliation would be discontinued on or after September 26, 2014,{{cite news|last1=Lafayette|first1=Jon|title=Exclusive: Radio Disney Moving Off Air to Digital|url=http://broadcastingcable.com/news/currency/exclusive-radio-disney-moving-air-digital/133166|accessdate=August 13, 2014|date=August 13, 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://radioinsight.com/blog/headlines/89717/radio-disney-to-sell-all-but-one-station/ |title=Radio Disney To Sell All But One Station |date=August 13, 2014 |accessdate=August 13, 2014 |last=Venta |first=Lance |publisher=Radio Insight }}{{cite web|title=Radio Disney to Sell the Majority of Its Stations|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/6214509/radio-disney-to-sell-the-majority-of-its-stations|website=Billboard|accessdate=13 August 2014|ref=13 August 2014}} but Disney has decided to keep the programming on KMKI until the sale of this and other RD stations take place. KMKI, now KEXB, has a license to broadcast a digital signal using iBiquity's "[[HD Radio]]" but has suspended transmission of such months prior to the sale announcement. Because the license to broadcast digital "HD Radio" is perpetual, the station could resume digital broadcasts at any time. ===Sale to Salem, change to Business=== On June 5, 2015, it was announced that Salem Media Group would acquire KMKI for $3 million.[http://radioinsight.com/blog/headlines/93236/salem-acquires-disney-stations-in-boston-dallas/ Salem Acquires Disney Stations in Boston and Dallas] - ''Radio Insight'' The station was sold to [[Salem Media Group]] on September 15, 2015http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/145622/oregon-fm-license-sold-puerto-rico-am-donated and, as a result, the station discontinued its Radio Disney affiliate and went silent. 620 AM returned to the air on September 18, 2015, simulcasting programming from [[KWRD-FM]]. On September 25, 2015, KMKI began simulcasting new sister [[KBDT|KVCE]].[http://www.dfw.com/2015/09/25/1034907_biz-talk-kvce1160-am-moving-to.html Biz-talk KVCE/1160 AM moving to 620 AM - DFW.com] KVCE's programming still had the branding and imaging of the 1160 frequency for one week, until October 1. Also on that day, KMKI changed call letters to '''KEXB''' (standing for “'''Ex'''perts in '''B'''usiness).https://licensing.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/pubacc/prod/call_hist.pl?Facility_id=49320&Callsign=KEXB The current Radio Disney programming for the region has since moved to the [[KLUV]] HD3 digital subchannel after the network's 7-month absence from the DFW market. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.dfwretroplex.com DFW Radio/TV History] {{AM station data|KEXB}} {{Dallas Fort Worth Radio}} {{News/Talk Radio Stations in Texas}} {{Salem Media Group}} {{coord|33|14|34|N|96|32|29|W|type:landmark_region:US|display=title}} [[Category:Radio stations established in 1939]] [[Category:Radio stations in the Dallas–Fort Worth metroplex|EXB]] [[Category:1939 establishments in Texas]] [[Category:Salem media properties]] [[Category:News and talk radio stations in the United States]] [[Category:Business talk radio stations]] [[Category:Business media in the United States]]

{{About|the process-management and improvement method|the lean-manufacturing process|Kanban}} {{Software development process}} '''Kanban''' (Mandarin Chinese 看板, Kànbǎn, "dashboard") is a [[lean manufacturing | lean method]] to manage and improve [[work (disambiguation) | work]] across human [[system]]s. This approach aims to manage work by balancing demands with available capacity, and by improving the handling of system-level [[Bottleneck (production) | bottlenecks]].
Work items are visualized to give participants a view of progress and process, from start to finish - usually via a [[Kanban board]]. Work is [[Push–pull strategy| pulled]] as capacity permits, rather than work being pushed into the process when requested.
In [[knowledge worker| knowledge work]] and in [[software development]], the aim is to provide a visual [[process management | process-management]] system which aids decision-making about what, when and how much to produce. The underlying [[Kanban]] method originated in [[lean manufacturing]]<ref>{{cite book|title= The Machine That Changed the World|year= 2007|author= James P. Womack|ISBN= 978-1847370556}} </ref> (inspired by the [[Toyota Production System]]<ref>{{cite book |title= Toyota Production System: Beyond Large-Scale Production |author=Taiichi Ohno |year=1988 |ISBN=978-0915299140 }}</ref>) it is now used in software development and technology-related work{{cn|date=October 2018}} and has been combined with other methods or frameworks such as [[Scrum (software development) |Scrum]].<ref> {{Cite book |url= https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/654393465 |title= Scrumban and other essays on Kanban System for Lean Software develoment |last=Corey |first=Ladas |date=2008 |publisher=Modus Cooperandi Press |isbn= 9780578002149|location= Seattle, Washington|oclc =654393465 }} </ref>
== Overview == {{Section OR|date=November 2018}} David Anderson's 2010 book, ''Kanban'',<ref>{{Cite book |title=Kanban: Successful Evolutionary Change for Your Technology Business |last=Anderson |first=David J. |date=April 2010 |publisher=Blue Hole Press |year= |isbn=0-9845214-0-2 |location=|pages=|via=}} </ref> describes the method's evolution from a 2004 project at Microsoft<ref>Anderson, David J. and Dragos Dumitriu. "From Worst to Best in 9 Months: Implementing a Drum-Buffer-Rope Solution at Microsoft’s IT Department". ''TOC ICO World Conference November 2005''. USA: Microsoft Corporation, 2005.</ref> using a [[theory of constraints]] approach and incorporating a [[Theory_of_constraints#Operations|drum-buffer-rope]] (which is comparable to the [[Kanban#Operation|kanban pull system]]), to a 2006-2007 project at [[Branded Entertainment Network|Corbis]] in which the kanban method was identified. In 2009, Don Reinertsen published a book on second-generation lean product development<ref name=":0">{{Cite book | title = The Principles of Product Development Flow: Second Generation Lean Product Development | last = Reinertsen | first = Donald | publisher = Celeritas Publishing | date = May 2009 | isbn = 978-1935401001 }} </ref> which describes the adoption of the kanban system and the use of data collection and an economic model for management decision-making. Another early contribution came from Corey Ladas, whose 2009 book ''Scrumban''<ref> {{Cite book | title =Scrumban: Essays on Kanban Systems for Lean Software Development | last =Ladas | first =Corey | publisher = Modus Cooperandi Press |date=January 2009 |isbn = 978-0578002149 }}</ref> suggested that kanban could improve [[Scrum (software development)|Scrum]] for software development. Ladas saw [[Scrumban]] as the transition from Scrum to Kanban. Jim Benson and Tonianne DeMaria Barry published ''Personal Kanban'',<ref>{{Cite book |title=Personal Kanban: Mapping Work, Navigating Life |last1=Benson |first1=Jim |last2=DeMaria Barry |first2=Tonianne |date=January 2011 |publisher=Modus Cooperandi Press |isbn=978-1453802267 |location=|pages=|via=}}</ref> applying Kanban to individuals and small teams, in 2011. In ''Kanban from the Inside'' (2014),<ref> {{Cite book |title=Kanban From The Inside |last=Burrows|first=Mike |publisher=Blue Hole Press|year=2014 |isbn=978-0-9853051-9-2|location=Seattle, WA|pages=|via=}}</ref> Mike Burrows explained kanban's principles, practices and underlying values and related them to earlier theories and models. ''Kanban Change Leadership'' (2015), by Klaus Leopold and Siegfried Kaltenecker,<ref> {{Cite book |title=Kanban Change Leadership |last1=Leopold|first1=Klaus |last2=Siegfried|first2=Kaltenecker |publisher=John Wiley & Sons|year=2015 |isbn=978-1-119-01970-1 |location=Hoboken, NJ|pages=|via=}}</ref> explained the method from the perspective of change management and provided guidance to change initiatives. A condensed guide to the method was published in 2016, incorporating improvements and extensions from the early kanban projects.<ref> {{Cite book |title=Essential Kanban Condensed |last1=Anderson|first1=David J. |last2=Carmichael|first2=Andy |publisher=Lean Kanban University Press|year=2016 |isbn=978-0-9845214-2-5 |location=Seattle, WA|pages=|via=}} </ref>
== {{anchor|Kanban Boards}}Kanban boards == {{Main|Kanban board}} [[File:Kanban board example.jpg|thumb]] Although Kanban does not require that the team or organization use a [[Kanban board]], they can be used to visualise the flow of work. Typically a Kanban board shows how work moves from left to right, each column represents a stage within the value stream.
The image below is a typical view of a simplified Kanban board, where work items move from left to right. In some cases each column has a work in progress limit. This means that each column can only receive a fixed amount of work items with the aim to encourage focus, and make system constraints evident.
== {{anchor|Examples of use}}Examples == === Software development ===
[[File:Sample Kanban Board.png|border|right|frameless]] The diagram here and the one in the Kanban Board section shows a software development workflow.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.infoq.com/minibooks/priming-kanban-jesper-boeg|title=Priming Kanban|author=Jasper Boeg|date=February 2012|accessdate=2014-02-17|publisher=InfoQ}}</ref> The boards, designed for the context in which they are used, vary considerably and may show work item types ("features" and "user stories" here), columns delineating workflow activities, explicit policies, and swimlanes (rows crossing several columns, used for grouping user stories by feature here). The aim is to make the general workflow and the progress of individual items clear to participants and stakeholders.
=== Other uses ===
Although it is usually used for software development and software teams, the kanban method has been applied to other aspects of knowledge work.<ref>Leybourn, E. (2013). Directing the Agile Organisation: A Lean Approach to Business Management. London: IT Governance Publishing: 160–66.</ref>. Business functions which have used kanban include: * [[Human resources]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.personalkanban.com/pk/designpatterns/kanban-for-short-intense-projects-how-we-used-kanban-to-visualize-our-hiring-process-workflow-and-make-our-lives-easier/ |title=Kanban for Short Intense Projects: How We Used Kanban to Visualize Our Hiring Process Workflow and Make Our Lives Easier |publisher=Personal Kanban |date=2011-01-19 |accessdate=2012-08-17}}</ref> and recruitment<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thesocialtester.co.uk/kanban-and-recruitment/ |title=Kanban and Recruitment |work=The Social Tester |date=2014-08-06 |accessdate=2015-06-08}}</ref> * Marketing * Organizational strategy and executive leadership<ref>{{cite web|url=http://agilebusinessmanagement.org/content/new-zealand-post-group-%E2%80%93-agile-executive|title=New Zealand Post Group - An Agile Executive! |publisher=Agile Business Management Consortium |date=2013-12-02 |accessdate=2015-06-08}}</ref>
== See also == *[[Lean software development]] *[[List of software development philosophies]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
== Further reading == * Kanban: Successful Evolutionary Change for Your Technology Business, David J. Anderson. (United States, Blue Hole Press, 2010. {{ISBN|978-0984521401}} * Scrumban: Essays on Kanban Systems for Lean Software Development, Corey Ladas. (United States, Modus Cooperandi Press, 2009. {{ISBN|9780578002149}} * ''Agile Project Management with Kanban (Developer Best Practices)'', Eric Brechner. (United States: Microsoft Press, 2015). {{ISBN|978-0735698956}}. * ''Kanban in Action'', Marcus Hammarberg and Joakim Sunden. (Shelter Island, NY: Manning Publications, 2014). {{ISBN|978-1-617291-05-0}}. * ''Lean from the Trenches: Managing Large-Scale Projects with Kanban,'' Henrik Kniberg. (Dallas, TX: The Pragmatic Programmers, 2012). {{ISBN|978-1-93435-685-2}}. * ''Stop Starting, Start Finishing!'' Arne Roock and Claudia Leschik. (USA: Lean-Kanban University, 2012). {{ISBN|978-0985305161}}. * ''Real-World Kanban: Do Less, Accomplish More with Lean Thinking'', Mattias Skarin. (United States: Pragmatic Bookshelf, 2015). {{ISBN|978-1680500776}}.

Μάκης Αγγελόπουλος | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Start date and years ago|df=yes|1964|7|}} | birth_place = [[Nea Smyrni, Greece]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = [[Athens]], [[Greece]] | nationality = [[Greece|Greek]] | other_names = | known_for = | education = | employer = | occupation = Shareholder of '''Neurosoft'''
Owner of '''[[AEK B.C.|AEK Athens B.C.]]''' | title = | salary = | | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = 3 | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Mavroeidis "Makis" Angelopoulos''' (alternate spellings: Mavroidis, Makis, Aggelopoulos) ([[Greek language|Greek]]: Μαυροειδής "Μάκης" Αγγελόπουλος) is the co-owner of the [[basketball]] team [[AEK B.C.|AEK Athens]]. ==Early life== Angelopoulos was born in [[Nea Smyrni]], [[Greece]] and was raised in [[Athens]]. ==Business career== ===Neurosoft=== Neurosoft was founded back in 1994. Currently maintains subsidiaries in [[Cyprus]] and [[Romania]] and presence in [[Albania]], [[Serbia]] and [[Bulgaria]]. Since 2009 started on the AIM market of the [[Borsa Italiana]], the trading of company's shares. In fact, it was the first IT company entered this market. Also, shareholders in the company are [[OPAP]] (with a rate of 30%) and [[International Game Technology|Lottomatica/Gtech]] (with a rate of 16.6%). ===AEK Athens B.C.=== In October, 2014, Angelopoulos became active for Greek basketball team [[AEK B.C.|AEK]], in order to bring the club back to success. On November 24, 2014, Angelopoulos became [[shareholder]] of AEK after he took the majority stake of the team (with a rate of 76%).{{cite web|title = Makis Angelopoulos (76% of AEK B.C.)| url = http://www.news.gr/athlhtika/mpasket/article/193433/ston-makh-aggelopoylo-me-76-h-mpasketikh-aek.html | publisher = news.gr | accessdate =}} On October 9, 2015, Angelopoulos became chairman of AEK B.C. {{cite web|title = New AEK B.C. chairman| url = http://www.sport-fm.gr/article/basket/proedros-stin-aek-o-aggelopoulos/3114002 | publisher = sport-fm.gr | accessdate =}} ==References== ==External links== *[http://aekbc.gr/en/ AEK B.C. site] {{AEK Athens B.C.}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Angelopoulos, Makis}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:AEK B.C.]] [[Category:Greek basketball chairmen and investors]] [[Category:1964 births]]

'''Malik Favzavievich Gaisin''' ({{lang-ru|Ма́лик Фавзавиевич Га́йсин}}; born 26 February 1959, in [[Yekaterinburg|Sverdlovsk]]) is a Russian entrepreneur and politician from [[Urals]].<ref name="bloomberg">https://www.bloomberg.com/Research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=50018173&privcapId=24226680&previousCapId=24226680&previousTitle=PJSC%20Uralhimmash</ref> He holds, or held, stakes in many major ventures in the region. In the past (1995–2000) he served as member of [[State Duma]] of the Russian Federation.
== Biography ==
In the end of 1980s he founded one of the first private businesses in [[Yekaterinburg|Sverdlovsk]] that transformed into a limited company specializing in buying [[Voucher privatization|vouchers]]. Later Gaisin through this company managed to acquire regional agricultural holdings. In 2004 claims were published, suggesting that Gaisin owned about 10% industry in the Urals at the time with share packages in more than 100 enterprises.<ref>{{Google books|UdsBUEQa6qIC|Privatising the State|page=202|keywords=Malik Gaisin|plainurl=}}</ref>
He was elected [[State Duma]] deputy in 1995 at [[Kamensk-Uralsky]] [[electoral district]] № 163.<ref>{{ru icon}} http://enc.ural.ru/index.php/Депутаты_Государственной_Думы_II_созыва,_избранные_от_округов_Урала</ref> As a [[member of parliament]], he served in the Duma's Committee on Budget, Taxes, Banks and Finance in [[Moscow]].
He was involved in many operations with industrial stakes in Urals, particularly with shares in the major [[Yekaterinburg]] factory [[Uralhimmash]],<ref>http://www.themoscowtimes.com/sitemap/free/2000/9/article/brawl-erupts-over-top-job-at-urals-factory/258821.html</ref> where he was appointed director in 2008. In 2014 he became head of [[Kalinin Machine-Building Plant]].<ref name="bloomberg" /> Latest news reports state that he is currently interested in state-owned bakery business in [[Beryozovsky, Sverdlovsk Oblast]].<ref>{{ru icon}} http://ystav.com/sverdlovskaya-oblast-tshhetno-pytaetsya-prodat-svoi-aktivy-aktsii-berezovskogo-hlebokombinata/</ref>

'''Marek Kamiński''' (born 24 March 1964 in [[Gdańsk]]) – [[Poles|Polish]] [[Polar explorer]], author, entrepreneur. Kamiński holds the [[Guinness World Records|Guinness World Record]] for being the first person to walk to both the [[North Pole]] and the [[South Pole]], solo and unsupported,<ref name=Guinness>[http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/records-5000/first-person-to-walk-to-both-poles-solo-and-unsupported/ FIRST PERSON TO WALK TO BOTH POLES SOLO AND UNSUPPORTED]. [[Guinness World Records]]. Last accessed 26 Feb 2012.</ref> even though it appears that [[Wojciech Moskal]] walked with him to the [[North Pole]] on 23 May 1995.<ref name=explorapoles>[http://www.explorapoles.org/explorers/profile/kaminski_marek/ Kaminski Marek (POLAND)]. ExploraPoles. Last accessed 26 Feb 2012.</ref> In the same year, on 27 December 1995, he reached the [[South Pole]] alone.<ref name=explorapoles/> He is also famous for the 2004 Together to the Pole Expedition to both Poles in a single year with disabled teenager [[Jan Mela]], with [[Wojciech Ostrowski]] and Wojciech Moskal (North Pole).
== Biography == He was brought up in [[Połczyn-Zdrój]] ([[Pomerania]]). In 1982 he graduated from Władysław Broniewski high school in [[Koszalin]]. He studied philosophy and physics at [[Warsaw University]] and an Advanced Management Program at [[IESE Business School]]. He is the founder and co-owner of a company called [[Invena S.A.]] and founder of the [[#Marek Kamiński Foundation|Marek Kamiński Foundation]].
He lives in [[Gdynia]] with his wife Katarzyna, daughter Pola and son Kay.
== Major expeditions == * 1977 - Denmark – first independent expedition, by cargo ship to the port of [[Aalborg]]; MR.Kris * 1978 - Morocco – by ship to the port of [[Safi, Morocco|Safi]]; * 1984 - USSR (now the territory of Russia), Scandinavia, Germany, Romania, Bulgaria, Greece, Turkey and Yugoslavia – [[hitchhiking]]; * 1985 - Cuba, Mexico (Mexico DF, Yucatán, Chiapas) – hitchhiking; * 1987 - Cuba, Mexico (Mexico DF, Yucatán, Oaxaca, Chihuahua, Chiapas) - hitchhiking; * 1990 - [[Spitsbergen]] – first solo Polar expedition (about 350 km on skis); * 1993 - “TransGreenland Expedition”– first Polish crossing of [[Greenland]], with Wojciech Moskal (about 600 km in 35 days); * 1995 - “Poles to the Pole” – reaching the North Pole from [[Ward Hunt Island]], with Wojciech Moskal (770 km in 72 days); * 1995 - “A Pole at the Poles” – solo expedition to the South Pole from [[Berkner Island]] (1,400 km in 53 days); * 1996/97 - “Solo TransAntarctica” – attempted solo crossing of Antarctica (1,450 km); * 1997/98 - Antarctica – crossing of the [[Ellsworth Mountains]] and reaching the summit of [[Mount Vinson]], with Leszek Cichy; * 1998 - Kilimanjaro, Kościuszko Mountain in Australia; * 1998 - Bolivia – expedition to the Bolivian Andes, reaching the summit of [[Huayna Potosi]], journey to Amazonia, with Børge Ousland; * 1999 - sailing across the Atlantic by yacht, the “Gemini”, with Andrzej Piotrowski; * 1999 - “Earth Expedition”, Australia – crossing the [[Gibson Desert]] (700 km in 60 days); * 2000 - “Purmo Greenland Expedition” – crossing Greenland, with Wojciech Ostrowski (600 km in 13 days); * 2000 - “Race 2000”, sailing across the Atlantic by catamaran, the “Polfarma – Warta”, with Roman Paszke; * 2000 - “Amazon Source 2000”, expedition to the sources of the Amazon under the patronage of the [[National Geographic Society]]; * 2001 - Zanzibar, [[Kilimanjaro]], with Katarzyna Pisera; * 2001 - “North Pole 2001”, first expedition of Polish tourists to the North Pole, as a guide; * 2001 - Dolomite (Cortino d’Ampezzo), with Katarzyna Pisera and Leszek Cichy; * 2002 - expedition to the North Pole as a guide; * 2002 - [[Dolomite]] (Marmolada), with Katarzyna Pisera; * 2003 - Holy Land: Jerusalem, [[Cesarea]], Netania, Masada, Tel Awiw – Jafa, with Katarzyna Pisera; * 2004 - “Together to the Pole” – expedition to both Poles in a single year with disabled teenager [[Jan Mela]], with Wojciech Ostrowski and Wojciech Moskal (North Pole); * 2005 - “Around the Baltic by Dinghy” – a five-day trip, a celebration of a 25th anniversary of Solidarność, with Mirosław Kukuła and Wojciech Ostrowski; * 2006 - “Baby on Board – Across Poland with Pola” – a journey across Poland, following the River [[Vistula]], with wife Katarzyna and daughter Pola; * 2007 - “Baby on Board – Across the World with Pola” – a journey to Norway ([[Oslo]], [[Finnmarksvidd]], [[Lofota]], [[Flamsban]]), with wife Katarzyna and daughter Pola. * 2008 - "HiFlyer Polar Ice Expedition" - reaching the [[Gunnbjørn Fjeld]] summit, the highest peak in [[Greenland]] (3694 m), with Leszek Cichy, Tomasz Walkiewicz, Mirosław Polowiec, Ryszard Rusinek. * 2009 - Summer Expedition Wisła * 2010- Winter Expedition Wisła
== Books == Marek Kamiński has written a number of books about his travels. These include: ''Moje bieguny. Dzienniki z wypraw 1990–1998'' (''My Poles – Expedition Diaries 1990-1998''), Ideamedia, Gdansk 1998 – awarded the [[Artus Prize]] in the Best Book of the Year 1998 category and the Amber Butterfly prize in the Arkady Fiedler Competition for the best Polish book on travel and tourism; ''Moje wyprawy'' (''My Expeditions''), Pascal, Bielsko-Biała 2001; and ''Razem na Biegun'' (''Together to the Pole''), Marek Kamiński Foundation, Gdansk 2005. He co-authored two books: Sławomir Swerpel, Marek Kamiński, Wojciech Moskal, ''Nie tylko Biegun'' (Not Just the Pole), Muza SA, Warsaw 1996 and Jacek Bunsch, Marek Kamiński, ''Poczta polska, czyli niezwykłe dzieje pewnego listu'' (The Polish Post, or the Unusual History of a Letter), Wydawnictwo Europa, Wrocław 2000.
His articles and photographs have also been published in many periodicals including ''[[National Geographic (magazine)|National Geographic]]'' and ''[[Voyage (magazine)|Voyage]]''.
== Films == * ''Zdobycie Bieguna Północnego'' (“Reaching the North Pole”), dir. J. Surdel (1995) * ''Dwa Bieguny w jednym roku. Arctica'' (“Two Poles in a Single Year – the Arctic”), dir. J. Surdel (1995) * ''Dwa Bieguny w jednym roku. Antarctica'' (“Two Poles in a Single Year – the Antarctic”), dir. J. Surdel (1996) * ''Tamtego lata w Patriot Hills'' (“That Summer in Patriot Hills”), dir. J. Surdel (1996) * ''Trzeci Biegun. Przerwana wyprawa'' (“The Third Pole – an Interrupted Expedition”), dir. J. Surdel (1997) * ''Transantarctica 96/97,'' dir. J. Surdel (1997) * Dlaczego? Wyprawa na Mt. Vinson (“Why? Expedition to Mount Vinson”), dir. W. Ostrowski (1998) * Portret męski we wnętrzu (“Portrait of a Man Inside”), dir. F. Bajon (1999) * Grenlandia za plecami Marka Kamińskiego (“Greenland Behind Marek Kamiński’s Back”), dir. W. Ostrowski (2000) * Razem na Biegun (“Together to the Pole”), dir. W. Ostrowski (2005) * White out. Wyprawa poza cień (“White-out – an Expedition Beyond the Shadows”), dir. W. Szumowski (2005) * Pontonem dookoła Bałtyku (“Around the Baltic by Dinghy”), dir. W. Ostrowski (2005) * Z Polą przez Polskę (“Across Poland with Pola”), dir. W. Szumowski (2007)
== Major awards == * Young Businessman of the Year 1994 in the Polish section of the international [[World Young Business Achiever]] competition (1994) * [[Knight’s Cross of the Order of Poland’s Renascence]], for reaching the North Pole, awarded by President [[Lech Wałęsa]] (1995) * Sports Minister’s Gold Medal for reaching the North Pole (1995) * [[TV Polonia]] Award “For Glorifying Poland and the Polish Spirit” (1996) * [[St Wojciech’s Medal]], an honorary decoration awarded by the Gdansk City Council, “For Making Gdansk Famous Worldwide” (1997) * [[Amber Butterfly Award]] in the Arkady Fiedler Competition for the book Moje bieguny. Dzienniki z wypraw 1990–1998 (1999) * [[Explorer 2000]] prize awarded at the Explorer’s Festival, Łódź (2000) * “Butterfly 2003” prize awarded by the Jolanta Kwaśniewska Foundation, for courage and presenting the disabled as fully able participants in public life (2004) * “Super Kolos 2004” prize awarded for the greatest sporting achievement in the history of Polish Polar exploration, which was reaching the North Pole on 23 May 1995 (2004) * Foreign Minister’s diploma for outstanding services to promoting Poland worldwide (2005) * “Intrepid Carer for the Sick and Disabled”, medal awarded by the Metropolitan of Gdansk, His Excellency Father Tadeusz Gocłowski (2005) * A special certificate - Hans Christian Andersen Ambassador (2005) * Business and Passion Prize awarded at the Explorer’s Festival, Łódź (2006) * [[St Brother Albert Medal]] for proving that a disabled person can be a fully able participant in public life, perform difficult tasks and make his dreams come true (2007) * Honorary citizenship of the City of Koszalin, Połczyn-Zdrój and [[Tarłów]] County
== Organizations == Marek Kamiński belongs to the following organisations: the Polish Business Roundtable, the [[Polish Writers' Union]], the [[Polish Academy of Sciences Committee for Polar Research]] (honorary member), and the [[Sopot Sailing Club]].
== Lectures == Marek Kamiński has many lectures in Poland, USA, and many other countries including Antarctica. Titles of his lectures include: "How the Impossible Becomes Possible" and "Expeditions to the Edges of My Dreams." He also conducts workshops and training for major Polish and foreign corporations, banks and insurance companies.
== Marek Kamiński Foundation == The Marek Kamiński Foundation was founded in 1996. It is involved in creating and running educational programmes, fund-raising for prostheses for those in need, and integrated camps for the disabled. Its statutory aims also include supporting exploration of the Polar regions and other places worldwide, promoting Polar studies and ecology and supporting young participants in expeditions.
The Foundation's major achievements include: * “Let’s Help Sick Children To Make Their Dreams Come True”, the first campaign by the Society, as a result of which the Foundation was founded. The funds raised were used to buy IV drips for children and to finance the upgrading of the Children’s Chemotherapy Ward at the Gdansk Medical Academy (1995) * Solo TransAntarctica, the organisation of a Polar expedition, part of which was an International Educational Programme run on the Internet (1996/97) * Organisation of a trip to Antarctica at Christmas for two children from the Ełk and Ostrołęka Children’s Homes. The trip was first prize in a competition testing knowledge of the South Pole region. (1996/97) * Organisation of an expedition to Mount Vinson, the highest peak in Antarctica (1997/98) * Organisation of a competition for children testing knowledge of Australia during an expedition to cross the Gibson Desert. Funding of the top prize, a trip to Sydney for the competition winners (1999) * Together to the Pole, organisation of expeditions by Marek Kamiński and disabled teenager Jasiek Mela to both Poles (2004) * Give Others a Chance, fund-raising to buy prostheses for the disabled during the first “Together to the Pole” expedition. The total raised – 733,227 zlotys – was used to finance the purchase of prostheses for 65 people nationwide (2004) * School At the Pole, organisation of an educational campaign (2004) * World Day of the Sick – nationwide campaign to distribute 10,000 copies of a book entitled Lulie’s Big Journey to children who were in hospital that day (February 2005) * School for Crossing Borders, organisation of a free camp for disabled children. For two weeks 30 disabled young people took part in sports activities and a wide variety of themed workshops (July 2005) * Help for Pakistan, raising donations for victims of the Pakistan earthquake (November 2005)

[[University of Chicago]] | parents = [[Manuel Villar]]
[[Cynthia Villar]] | spouse = Emmeline Yan Aglipay | children = Emma Therese | religion = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Mark Aguilar Villar''' (born August 14, 1978) is a [[Filipino people|Filipino]] politician and businessman currently serving as [[Secretary of Public Works and Highways (Philippines)|Secretary of Public Works and Highways]] of the Philippines. He is the son of former [[President of the Senate of the Philippines|Senate President]] and 2010 presidential candidate [[Manny Villar]] and incumbent Senator [[Cynthia Villar]]. He served as Representative of [[Legislative district of Las Piñas|Las Piñas]] in the [[Philippine House of Representatives]] and has also previously held executive positions in his family's real estate businesses. A member of the [[Nacionalista Party]], Villar accepted the offer of President [[Rodrigo Duterte]] to join his Cabinet on May 17, 2016 and assumed office upon his resignation from Congress on August 1, 2016 replacing [[Rafael Yabut]].{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/business/05/17/16/villar-son-accepts-public-works-portfolio |title=Villar son accepts public works portfolio |publisher=[[ABS-CBN News]] |date=17 May 2016 |accessdate=24 June 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/801945/villar-resigns-as-las-pinas-rep-takes-on-dpwh-post |title=Villar resigns as Las Piñas rep, takes on DPWH post |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |author=Cayabyab, M.J. |date=2 August 2016 |accessdate=3 August 2016}} == Early life == Villar was born on August 14, 1978 to real estate tycoon and politician [[Manny Villar]] and his wife, Senator [[Cynthia Villar]]. He is the second of three children, with an older brother, Paolo, and younger sister, Camille. He attended the [[International School Manila]] in [[Makati, Metro Manila]] before moving to the United States to pursue higher education.{{cite web|url=http://manilastandardtoday.com/mobile/article/149888 |title=Born into it |publisher=[[The Standard (Philippines)|The Standard]] |author=Vasquez, D.C. |date=14 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2016}} He earned his bachelor's degree in Economics, Political Science and Philosophy from the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania]]. He also finished his master's degree in Business Administration from the [[University of Chicago Booth School of Business]]. On his return to the Philippines, he worked for 10 years in the family's real estate business. He was President of Crown Asia Corporation before becoming Managing Director of [[Vista Land & Lifescapes]]. == Political career == Villar was first elected to public office in 2010 as congressman of the lone district of Las Piñas, succeeding his mother, Cynthia Villar, a three-term representative who became senator. During his term, he served as Chairman of the House Committee on Trade and Industry, as well as Vice Chairman of the House Committees on Overseas Workers Affairs, Labor and Employment, and Science and Technology. As a member of the [[15th Congress of the Philippines|15th]] and [[16th Congress of the Philippines|16th Congress]], he authored several bills on education, health and livelihood, including the Negosyo Act promoting micro finance and the Lemon Law protecting buyers of motor vehicles. He was also one of the proponents of the Co-Loading Act which opened domestic transport and shipping to foreign vessels. Villar ran for a third term during the [[Philippine House of Representatives elections, 2016|2016 elections]] and won. A special election will be held to replace Villar who joined the Cabinet of President Rodrigo Duterte on August 1, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/comelec-to-conduct-las-pinas-special-polls/263183/ |title=Comelec to conduct Las Piñas special polls |publisher=[[The Manila Times]] |date=20 May 2016 |author=Depasupil, W. |accessdate=24 June 2016}} Pending the special election to be held in [[Las Piñas]] to fill in Villar's seat in the lower house, House Speaker [[Pantaleon Alvarez]] has designated his wife, Emmeline Aglipay Villar, as interim representative. == Personal life == Villar is married to fellow lawmaker, DIWA Party-list Representative Emmeline Yan Aglipay. They have a daughter, Emma Therese.{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/cong-mark-villar-focuses-on-family/ |title=Cong. Mark Villar focuses on family |publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]] |author=Pizarro, S. |date=3 June 2016 |accessdate=24 June 2016}} == References == {{reflist}} {{S-start}} {{s-par|ph-lwr}} {{s-bef|before= [[Cynthia Villar]]}} {{s-ttl|title= Member of the [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|Philippine House of Representatives]] from [[Legislative district of Las Piñas|Las Piñas' Lone District]]|years=2010–2016}} {{s-aft|after= Emmeline Aglipay Villar}} |- {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Rafael Yabut]]

{{Infobox software | name = OmniFocus | logo = OmniFocus_Mac_1.10.png | logo size = 64px | screenshot = OmniFocus Screenshot.png | screenshot size = 250px | caption = OmniFocus 2.1 running on [[OS X Yosemite]] | author = | developer = [[The Omni Group]] | released = | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | operating system = [[macOS]], [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]] ([[iPhone]], [[iPod touch]], [[iPad]]) | platform = | language = English, Japanese, French, German, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, Italian, Dutch, and Simplified Chinese | genre = | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] | website = [http://www.omnigroup.com/applications/omnifocus/ omnigroup.com/applications/omnifocus/] }} '''OmniFocus''' is a personal [[Task management|task manager]] by [[The Omni Group]] for [[macOS]] and [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]]. The declared goal of the program is to be able to capture thoughts and ideas into [[to do list]]s.<ref name="OmniFocus Overview">OmniFocus Overview, http://www.omnigroup.com/products/omnifocus/</ref> The program uses concepts and techniques described in the book ''[[Getting Things Done]]'' by [[David Allen (author)|David Allen]]. Allen's productivity system is commonly abbreviated as GTD.
== History == OmniFocus has its roots in the Kinkless kGTD add/scripts for the Omnigroups [[OmniOutliner]] product.<ref name='Oreilly Radar 2006-10-21'>{{cite web |url=http://radar.oreilly.com/archives/2006/10/the-story-of-kgtd-and-omnifocu.html |title=The Story of KGTD and OmniFocus |accessdate=2009-01-13 |last=Forrest |first=Brady |date=2006-10-21 |publisher=OReilly Publishing |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080502123106/http://radar.oreilly.com/archives/2006/10/the-story-of-kgtd-and-omnifocu.html |archivedate=2008-05-02 |df= }}</ref> Kinkless (kGTD) was developed by Ethan J. A. Schoonover to enable those following the GTD methodology. The Omni Group subsequently brought Ethan along with [[Merlin Mann]] to form a project team to create the OmniFocus application.<ref name='Omni Group interview: part 1'>{{cite web|url=http://en.onsoftware.com/omnigroup-interview-part-1/ |title=The Story of KGTD and OmniFocus |accessdate=2009-01-13 |last=Roger |first=Cyril |date=2007-05-08 |publisher=onsoftware }}</ref>
In 2018, version 3 of OmniFocus was released for iOS and macOS. With the release, the previous concept of contexts taken from GTD was replaced with tags.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.macstories.net/reviews/omnifocus-3-review-more-approachable-and-powerful-all-at-once/|title=OmniFocus 3 Review: More Approachable and Powerful, All at Once|website=MacStories||date=2018-05-30|access-date=2018-10-12}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.macstories.net/reviews/omnifocus-3-for-mac-multiple-tags-enhanced-forecast-powerful-perspectives/|title=OmniFocus 3 for Mac: Multiple Tags, Enhanced Forecast, Powerful Perspectives|website=MacStories||date=2018-09-24|access-date=2018-10-12}}</ref>
==Platforms==
===macOS=== OmniFocus is available for macOS.
===iOS=== OmniFocus is available on iOS (including the iPod Touch, iPhone, and iPad).
===Android=== The Omni Group does not have plans to provide an Android application for OmniFocus. [[Google Play]] lists various third-party applications which interface with OmniFocus through the Omni Sync Server (e.g., [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.burgstaller.android.focusgtd Focus GTD]).
=== Web Application === On January 26, 2018 Ken Case announced in the Omnigroup forums that Omnifocus for the web is under development. It will not be a standalone version; it will only sync with existing databases setup with the MacOS or iOS versions of Omnifocus. A subscription fee will be charged for access.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://discourse.omnigroup.com/t/omni-roadmap-2018/36393#omnifocus3web|title=Omni Roadmap 2018|website=The Omni Group Forums|language=en|access-date=2018-01-27}}</ref>

{{BLP sources|date=September 2015}} '''Onsi Sawiris''' (also written '''Sawires''', {{Lang-cop|Ⲟⲩⲛⲥⲓ Ⲥⲉⲩⲏⲣⲟⲥ}}, {{lang-ar|أنسي ساويرس}}; born August 14, 1930) is an [[Egyptians|Egyptian]] [[businessman]]. He was estimated to be worth approximately $1.2 billion according to ''[[Forbes]]'' in 2017.<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/profile/onsi-sawiris Onsi Sawiris - Forbes] Forbes.com, Accessed on May 11, 2011.</ref> He is the patriarchal head of the [[Sawiris Family]].
In his early business career, he was disenchanted with the socialist government of Egyptian president [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]]. He was prevented from leaving the country for six years in the 1960s.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2010/feb/02/sawiris-independent|title=The Sawiris family: from entrepreneurs to media owners|last=Tryhorn|first=Chris|date=2010-02-02|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-09-12|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> After a spell in [[Libya]], he returned to Egypt during the more business-friendly regime of the following Egyptian president, [[Anwar Sadat]]. He and his three sons, all educated in Europe and the United States, resumed their activities in Egypt over the past three decades under the government of [[Hosni Mubarak]] and its liberal business policies.
He founded the [[Orascom group|Orascom conglomerate]], whose various construction, telecommunications and tourism, science and technology and industry companies are run by his three sons, [[Naguib Sawiris]], [[Nassef Sawiris]], [[Samih Sawiris]]. Orascom is involved in [[tourism|tourism development]], [[telecommunication]]s, [[construction]] and other fields.

{{Wiktionary|out-of-pocket}} An '''out-of-pocket expense''' (or '''out-of-pocket cost''') is the direct payment of money that may or may not be later [[reimbursement|reimbursed]] from a third-party source.
For example, when operating a vehicle, [[gasoline]], parking fees and [[Road pricing|tolls]] are considered out-of-pocket expenses for a trip. [[Car insurance]], [[oil]] changes, and [[interest]] are not, since the outlay of cash covers expenses accrued over a longer period of time. The services rendered and other in-kind expenses are not considered out-of-pocket expenses; the same goes for [[depreciation]] of [[capital goods]] or [[depletion (accounting)|depletion]].
Organizations often reimburse out-of-pocket expenses incurred on their behalf, especially expenses incurred by employees on their employers' behalf. In the [[United States]], out-of-pocket expenses for such things as charity, medical bills, and education may be deductions on [[US income taxes]], according to [[IRS]] regulations.
To be '''out of pocket''' is to have expended personal resources, often unexpectedly or unfairly, at the end of some enterprise.
==Health financing== In the [[Health care system#Financing|health care financing]] sector, this represents the share of the expenses that the insured party must pay directly to the health care provider, without a third-party (insurer, or government).<ref name="pmid17625126">{{cite journal|vauthors=McWilliams JM, Meara E, Zaslavsky AM, Ayanian JZ | title=Use of health services by previously uninsured Medicare beneficiaries. | journal=N Engl J Med | year= 2007 | volume= 357 | issue= 2 | pages= 143–53 | doi=10.1056/NEJMsa067712 | pmc= | pmid=17625126 }}</ref>
'''United States'''
Out-of-pocket costs are high especially when it comes to prescription drugs in the United States.<ref name="pmid23550670">{{cite journal|vauthors=Hurd MD, Martorell P, Delavande A, Mullen KJ, Langa KM | title=Monetary costs of dementia in the United States. | journal=N Engl J Med | year= 2013 | volume= 368 | issue= 14 | pages= 1326–34 | pmid=23550670 | doi=10.1056/NEJMsa1204629 | pmc=3959992 }}</ref> Before investing in a health care plan, it is very useful to examine the out-of-pocket prescription costs as they may be very low or very high. High out-of-pocket costs may correlate with lower prescription adherence and more importation of medications from foreign countries.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Zullo|first1=AR|last2=Howe|first2=CJ|last3=Galárraga|first3=O|title=Estimating the Effect of Health Insurance on Personal Prescription Drug Importation.|journal=Medical care research and review : MCRR|date=2 February 2016|pmid=26837427|doi=10.1177/1077558716629039|volume=74|pmc=4970983|pages=178–207}}</ref><ref name="pmid20818845">{{cite journal |vauthors=Kogan MD, Newacheck PW, Blumberg SJ, Ghandour RM, Singh GK, Strickland BB, etal | title=Underinsurance among children in the United States. | journal=N Engl J Med | year= 2010 | volume= 363 | issue= 9 | pages= 841–51 | doi=10.1056/NEJMsa0909994 | pmc= | pmid=20818845 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|last1=Zullo|first1=Andrew R.|last2=Dore|first2=David D.|last3=Galárraga|first3=Omar|title=Development and validation of an index to predict personal prescription drug importation by adults in the United States|journal=Journal of Pharmaceutical Health Services Research|date=March 2015|volume=6|issue=1|pages=33–41|doi=10.1111/jphs.12088|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/jphs.12088/full|accessdate=27 July 2015|pmc=4930104}}</ref> [[Medicare Part D]] is a federal program aimed at lowering prescription drug costs for Medicare beneficiaries. However, after the first year of Medicare Part D, out-of-pocket drug costs were down, but there was not a noticeable reduction in [[emergency department]] visits, hospitalization, or health utility score. Perhaps, some diseases will be more sensitive to Medicare Part D.<ref name="pmid23635051">{{cite journal |vauthors=Baicker K, Taubman SL, Allen HL, Bernstein M, Gruber JH, Newhouse JP, etal | title=The Oregon experiment--effects of Medicaid on clinical outcomes. | journal=N Engl J Med | year= 2013 | volume= 368 | issue= 18 | pages= 1713–22 | pmid=23635051 | doi=10.1056/NEJMsa1212321 | pmc=3701298 | url=http://dspace.mit.edu/bitstream/1721.1/82640/1/Gruber_The%20oregon%20experiment.pdf }}</ref><ref>[http://content.healthaffairs.org/content/26/6/1735.full The Impact Of Medicare Part D On Prescription Drug Use By The Elderly]. Content.healthaffairs.org. Retrieved on 2011-04-17.</ref>
'''Australia'''
A recent study published from Australia shows that the out-of-pocket cost burden falls most heavily on patients who are least able to bear it, both in terms of their health and in terms of their income. Among the respondents 14% experienced a heavy financial burden. Medication and medical service expenses were the major costs. This study concluded that despite Australia's universal health coverage (medicare) a substantial portion of senior citizens suffer from excessive out-of-pocket expenditure, and this burden increases with increasing number of chronic conditions. Among the specific conditions, those who experienced cancer, high blood pressure, diabetes or depression were likely to report higher out-of-pocket expenditure.<ref>{{cite journal |author=Islam, MM |author2=Yen, L |author3=Valderas, JM |author4=McRae, I |last-author-amp=yes |title= Out-of-pocket expenditure by Australian seniors with chronic disease: the effect of specific diseases and morbidity clusters |journal=BMC Public Health |volume=14 |pages=1008 |year=2014 |pmid= 25260348 |doi=10.1186/1471-2458-14-1008 |pmc=4182884}}</ref>
Some ways to improve physician knowledge of drug costs were thought to be increased physician-patient communication or higher use of information technology. Physicians with high rates of IT use did not have significantly higher knowledge or drug costs. Health IT design should be improved to make it easier for physicians to access cost information at the point of care.<ref>[http://codingandbillingcareer.org/health-information-technology/]</ref>
